question: Which country houses "Tallinn Song Festival Grounds"?
explanation: Tallinn's Song Festival Grounds, completed in 1960 were the first modern post-war construction to be built in Tallinn, the capital city of Estonia. The design of the grounds took into account the nature of the land they were to be built on:- audience would be seated on the slope of the hill, so the song arch would need to echo sound to them. This ground is best known as the place where every five years, the Estonian Song Festival, which is one of the largest choral events in the world and a UNESCO Masterpiece of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity.
